channel.title: Programs/Tips to boost FPS?
channel.description:
Has anyone got any good tips or programs I could help reduce lag? I'm getting a rough 60 FPS in Minecraft, and 25-40 FPS on LoL I also run frequent virus scans, so yeah.
[spoiler=Programs I'm currently using:] [url=http://www.razerzone.com/gb-en/gamebooster]~ Razer Game Booster[/url][/spoiler]
And please don't reply to me by saying: "Buy a new computer u faggot duhh"
[IMG]http://i58.tinypic.com/mhairr.png[/img]

item.title: Programs/Tips to boost FPS?
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

[quote=“Limits, post:18, topic:546109”][quote author=Lil_Smok3r link=topic=665004.msg4445644#msg4445644 date=1408654562]
Say if I bought two 8GB ram sticks, and then I got 16GB, how many rates (estimated) will it improve my fps by?
[/quote]
Tbh, RAM doesnt really affect fps. Your graphics card does. What would more memory do if your graphics card cant process all the data coming in?[/quote]
This. A game shouldn’t take up anywhere close to what you have available in RAM, the only time it will effect your gameplay is if your RAM consumption is in the higher numbers. While it’s easy to fill up 4GB of RAM, if nothing else is running in the background while you’re playing a game, and the RAM usage is low, 4GB to 16GB won’t show a change. Other than disabling tasks to free up disk and RAM there’s nothing you can do without replacing parts. If I was you I’d upgrade to 8GB of RAM personally, just so you can handle more at a time. The best thing for improving your FPS, much like Limits said is to get a better graphics card, more VRAM and other such things is how you will achieve a better FPS. Another thing that might improve your gameplay is getting a faster HDD. Read/Write speeds can be a big deal in games that make those calls alot.

Read full topic

Say if I bought two 8GB ram sticks, and then I got 16GB, how many rates (estimated) will it improve my fps by?

Tbh, RAM doesnt really affect fps. Your graphics card does. What would more memory do if your graphics card cant process all the data coming in?

item.title: Programs/Tips to boost FPS?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Justin Bieber:

what a hilariously uninformed post

I don’t see how. All that I’ve said was based on my own research from around the net. Sure it’s not the most accurate, and there are most definitely better guides on getting more performance out of your computer. But running extra programs doesn’t increase anything.
If you run a program to close programs, yes that will improve your performance of your computer. But that program is also taking up resources, even if it’s very little compared to the ones you exited.

If you would like to give him a better answer than what I have provided, by all means do so. If not, I think you should withhold your comments, as you’re not helping him with his question.

Read full topic

item.title: Programs/Tips to boost FPS?
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:2, topic:546109”]LOL.
Wait.
You want to run another program to make your performance in a different one to be better? Are you even hearing yourself?
That’s like trying to download more RAM.

You want to run less programs. Not more. More will cause more lag, and less FPS.

First off, regardless of what you said in OP. A new computer is seriously what you should consider. I’m not saying it just because you said not to.
You’re on a 32 bit OS, assuming it was factory installed, your motherboard is only a 32 bit. Games are better on 64 bit (and some other things) PCs.

Also, why is your computer only used 3 of 4 gigs of RAM? If it can only use 3 gigs, well. I don’t see you running very many quality games (and this could be one root of your problems).

The processor seems alright, as I can’t seem to find a page for yours. I’m basing it on the fact you have 3.4GHz. Not to shabby but you ain’t the penis of the block either.

And… Well. That’s all I can say without you posting more specs (graphics card would seriously help…).

Again: Don’t get more programs, try and limit the ones you’re running when gaming. I believe the Razor gaming booster thing you’re using already does that (while still running and taking up processes on its own). I typically like to run the task manager and end processes on my own.[/quote]what a hilariously uninformed post

Read full topic

item.title: Programs/Tips to boost FPS?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

LOL.
Wait.
You want to run another program to make your performance in a different one to be better? Are you even hearing yourself?
That’s like trying to download more RAM.

You want to run less programs. Not more. More will cause more lag, and less FPS.

First off, regardless of what you said in OP. A new computer is seriously what you should consider. I’m not saying it just because you said not to.
You’re on a 32 bit OS, assuming it was factory installed, your motherboard is only a 32 bit. Games are better on 64 bit (and some other things) PCs.

Also, why is your computer only used 3 of 4 gigs of RAM? If it can only use 3 gigs, well. I don’t see you running very many quality games (and this could be one root of your problems).

The processor seems alright, as I can’t seem to find a page for yours. I’m basing it on the fact you have 3.4GHz. Not to shabby but you ain’t the cock of the block either.

And… Well. That’s all I can say without you posting more specs (graphics card would seriously help…).

Again: Don’t get more programs, try and limit the ones you’re running when gaming. I believe the Razor gaming booster thing you’re using already does that (while still running and taking up processes on its own). I typically like to run the task manager and end processes on my own.

Read full topic
